page.title: 19Religion In Hoo.
page.content: The church of Hoo St Werburgh dates back to the Twelfth Century and its spire is a local landmark. {Congregations}vary in size but average about 50 on a normal Sunday. The church bells are used by an active team of 9 bellringers. The Sunday School is united with the local {Methodist Church}and consists of about 60 children between 4 and 12 years. {The Methodist Church}is in Bells Lane and is part of the Strood circuit. In addition there is a{Catholic Church}in the Stoke Road.'Church' and 'non-church' meetings are held in the various church-buildings during the week including Young Wives,Women's Institute,flower arranging and dancing classes.
